Game.Name: Power League III (Japan)
Game.plot: Power League III is a Sports game, published by Hudson,which was released in Japan in 1990.Cheat: Hidden TeamsAt the team selection screen in any mode (except the Pennant mode), hold the following buttons:Cheat: Hidden TeamsEnter the Pennant Mode and choose New Game. Pick your team and then the number of games, but before going on any further, hold Run and press Select to reset the game. Now, enter the Pennant Mode again, pick your team and hold Run and press Select to reset the game again. Finally, choose the Pennant Mode again and you'll automatically be at the Japan Series.Cheat: Hidden TeamsAt any mode except the Pennant mode, after choosing your Team and the CPU's Team, press Left or Right to change who pitches first.
Game.Notes: Power League III is a baseball game from Hudson Soft and the third of six games in their Power League franchise to be released for the PC Engine. It features fictional teams and players and includes All-Star, Pennant and Open modes, as well as a non-competitive Home Run Derby mode. It received various minor enhancements and additions from Power League II, including more realistic and easier to catch flyballs and graphical variation in the batters to help distinguish them from one another. The Power League series would see three more sequels for the PC Engine before jumping ship to the Super Famicom. Only the first game in the series, World Class Baseball, would ever see a US localization.
